description:
A transparent, device-agnostic cardiovascular fitness and RHR tracker.

PAIesque: A Cardiovascular Fitness Tracker

Prerequisite To get started, you must first install and configure Gadgetbridge to collect heart rate data from your compatible fitness tracker or smartwatch.

PAIesque calculates a transparent, heart-rate-reserve-based cardiovascular fitness score and tracks your Resting Heart Rate (RHR). It provides a device-agnostic, privacy-focused alternative to proprietary health metrics.

The Score: Unlike a "black box" algorithm, PAIesque calculates your fitness score using a fully disclosed formula based on the established Karvonen Heart Rate Reserve (HRR) method, inspired by research from the NTNU Cardiac Exercise Research Group (CERG). This provides a consistent, science-inspired metric for tracking cardiovascular activity levels, independent of wearable brand or ecosystem.

Key Differentiators:

  • Open & Transparent: Every calculation is visible and verifiable. It is not a reverse-engineered clone but a principled, open-source implementation of HRR-based scoring.
  • Universal & Consistent: Get the same scoring methodology across any fitness tracker supported by Gadgetbridge (Amazfit, Garmin, Xiaomi, Fitbit, and 100+ more). Your historical data remains comparable even if you switch devices.
  • Privacy-First & Local: All processing happens on your device. Your heart rate data never leaves your phone, and no internet connection or subscription is required.

Note: This is an independent, community-developed application. While based on public scientific principles of heart rate reserve and long-term health, it is not affiliated with or endorsed by NTNU CERG, and its score is distinct from the proprietary Personal Activity Intelligence (PAIÂ®) metric.
